messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] typing program
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/25/02 7:55:51 PM, felesina@cwnet.com writes:  There are some typing games
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/25/02 7:55:51 PM, felesina@... writes:

<< Was it this list that posted a really cool typing program? >>

There are some typing games you can download cheap or free.

KeyBoom has gotten a lot of use from teens in this house. I'm third on the
score list, and I've clocked at 90+ wpm on 'real' typing tests.

It's not 'real' typing, is the problem! But two visitors who never took a
typing class can both beat me at it.

And Mavis Beacon? Drives me crazy. I can't score well because they don't
let you keep going after a mistake.

We used to have Mario Types and it was fun, but computers come and go and
it's in a really old format.

Sandra

messages.subject: typing program
messages.msgSnippet: Was it this list that posted a really cool typing program? My dd wants one...I think it was some name like, type for fun type and learn or something (well
messages.messageBody:
Was it this list that posted a really cool typing program?

My dd wants one...I think it was some name like, "type for fun" "type and
learn" or something (well they are all named something like that! ha!)

Bronwen
